label: lem-polynomial-patch-monotonicity
name: Monotonicity of the Polynomial Patch
relations_established: Cubic patch P(z) is monotone non-decreasing via Fritsch-Carlson/Hyman conditions
natural_language_statement: Let $z_0=z_{\max}-1$, $z_1=z_{\max}$, $y_0=\log(z_{\max})+1$, $y_1=\log(1+z_{\max})+1$, and endpoint slopes $m_0=P'(z_0)=1/z_{\max}$, $m_1=P'(z_1)=0$. Set the secant $\Delta:=(y_1-y_0)/(z_1-z_0)=\log(1+1/z_{\max})>0$. Then the Hermite cubic $P$ on $[z_0,z_1]$ with $(y_0,m_0),(y_1,m_1)$ is monotonically non‑decreasing.
full_statement_text: Let $z_0=z_{\max}-1$, $z_1=z_{\max}$, $y_0=\log(z_{\max})+1$, $y_1=\log(1+z_{\max})+1$, and endpoint slopes $m_0=P'(z_0)=1/z_{\max}$, $m_1=P'(z_1)=0$. Set the secant $\Delta:=(y_1-y_0)/(z_1-z_0)=\log(1+1/z_{\max})>0$. Then the Hermite cubic $P$ on $[z_0,z_1]$ with $(y_0,m_0),(y_1,m_1)$ is monotonically non‑decreasing.
